title: How Car Shortages Are Putting the World’s Economy at Risk
content: Because so many jobs depend on automaking, the industry’s production problems are causing the pain to ripple.

more_info.byline: By Jack Ewing and Patricia Cohen

title: Corporate Climate Pledges Often Ignore a Key Component: Supply Chains
content: Many companies do not account for the emissions from their supply chains, which can be a significant majority of their contributions to greenhouse gases.

more_info.byline: By Michael Corkery and Julie Creswell
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: How the Pandemic Has Added to Labor Unrest
content: While big companies wield considerable power, Covid’s economic disruption has given workers new leverage, contributing to a recent upturn in strikes.

org_facet: International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees

title: Regulators Ask Congress to Create New Rules for Cryptocurrencies
content: A Treasury Department report says stablecoin issuers should operate like banks to avoid destabilizing runs that could erode financial stability.

more_info.byline: By Ephrat Livni and Eric Lipton

title: Europe Fears That Rising Cost of Climate Action Is Stirring Anger
content: Memories of the Yellow Vest movement are prompting officials to ensure that spiking energy prices don’t fuel inequality or populist discontent.

title: The TV Hit That Wasn’t
content: There was a lot of advance hype for the FX series “Impeachment: American Crime Story.” But it won’t be available on any major streaming platform for another 10 months, and that’s a problem in 2021.

title: Banks Tried to Kill Crypto and Failed. Now They’re Embracing It (Slowly).
content: Digital payments technology is forcing the financial system to evolve. Banks feel their power waning and want to regain control.

org_facet: Bank of New York Mellon Corporation
Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

title: After the Flood, It’s Not Just ‘About the Coming Back’
content: Following the devastation wrought by Hurricane Ida in Millburn, N.J., small business owners are facing an uncertain future, even as the community rallies to help.

title: BP’s profit rises as oil and gas prices soar.
content: The London-based energy giant said it had benefited from reviving demand for oil and OPEC’s management of output.

org_facet: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

title: Jeff Bezos, who recently flew into space, vows to do more to protect the Earth.
content: The billionaire called the loss of Earth’s forests “a profound and urgent danger to us all.”

more_info.byline: By Marc Santora and Nicholas Kulish

title: Funding for start-ups founded by women is surging.
content: Women raised almost twice as much venture capital funding in the first nine months of this year as they did in 2020 or 2019.

title: As U.S. Reopening Approaches, Travelers Take Their Marks
content: The end of the U.S. ban on international visitors has kicked off a surge in travel both foreign and domestic. Here’s what to expect for the holiday season and beyond.

title: How Greek Islands Are Labs for Clean Energy
content: Many Greek islands are being used for innovative experiments to drive the clean power shift.

title: A cryptocurrency inspired by ‘Squid Game’ crashes. The industry has questions.
content: The digital money, called Squid, began trading last week for a penny. It soared spectacularly, before the money vanished.

title: Attack Left Flight Attendant With Concussion and Facial Injury, Authorities Say
content: The chief executive of American Airlines called the violent encounter on a California-bound flight from New York last week “one of the worst displays of unruly behavior we’ve ever witnessed.”

title: Rivian edges closer to an I.P.O., seeking a valuation above $50 billion.
content: The company updated registration documents with the Securities and Exchange Commission on Monday.

title: PG&E says it faces a federal inquiry and $1.15 billion in losses over the Dixie fire.
content: The California utility already faces state criminal charges over the blaze this year, the second largest wildfire ever recorded in the state.

title: Even as Biden Pushes Clean Energy, He Seeks More Oil Production
content: President Biden acknowledged “it seems like an irony” that he is asking energy-rich nations to boost oil production as he implores the world to tackle climate change.

more_info.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Lisa Friedman
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Changing of the Guard at Williamstown Theater Festival
content: Mandy Greenfield has resigned and Jenny Gersten will be interim artistic director. The festival gave no reason for the move, but it follows complaints about working conditions.

title: Amazon to Launch First Two Internet Satellites in 2022
content: Competing with SpaceX, OneWeb and others, the e-commerce titan will rely on small rockets to get prototypes of its satellite constellation into space.

title: The Biden administration will publish vaccine mandate rules ‘in the coming days.’
content: The Labor Department has completed a draft of an emergency standard, which is under review. When it is released, a flurry of corporate vaccine mandates is expected to follow.

title: Biden Promised to Fix Home Care for Seniors. Much More Help May Be Needed.
content: The latest Democratic proposal would funnel $150 billion toward subsidized home and community-based care. Experts worry that may not be enough to ease the severe shortage of workers.

title: Why Jeffrey Epstein Cost Barclays’s C.E.O. His Job
content: British regulators had examined what Jes Staley told his bank’s board about ties to the disgraced financier.

more_info.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin, Jason Karaian, Sarah Kessler, Stephen Gandel, Michael J. de la Merced, Lauren Hirsch and Ephrat Livni

title: Can Supersonic Air Travel Fly Again?
content: The key to its revival may be a breakthrough in creating a quieter sonic boom. The challenges, though, are significant.

title: James Staley, Barclays’s C.E.O., steps down after a Jeffrey Epstein inquiry.
content: British regulators investigated how the bank executives characterized his ties with the disgraced financier.

more_info.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Matthew Goldstein

title: To Protest Iran’s Anti-Gay Abuses, an Artist Painted a Dictator’s Car
content: “Wherever there is injustice, we need to talk about it,” Alireza Shojaian said.

des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

title: Why a Pilot Is Under Investigation for Saying ‘Let’s Go Brandon’
content: His remarks went viral after he repeated the chant, which is understood to be code for swearing at President Biden, during a Southwest Airlines flight.

title: Struggling at Home, Biden Is Buoyed by G20 Trip Abroad
content: A trip to Rome invigorated a president whose poll numbers are slumping at home, but who projected confidence in his foreign and domestic agenda.

more_info.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Katie Rogers
des_facet: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change

title: Learning to Live With Mark Zuckerberg
content: Journalists and tech executives seem to be fighting each other to a draw in a battle that has no end in sight.

title: Roblox Goes Down, Forcing Children Outside for Halloween
content: After three days offline, the popular gaming site said Sunday that it was back. In the meantime, children were freaking out.

title: Angling for a Merry ‘Fishmas’ Despite Global Shipping Delays
content: The travails of a Chicago fishing company’s advent calendar highlight the supply chain hurdles for businesses trying to deliver items in time for the holidays.

title: American Airlines canceled more than 1,200 flights over the weekend.
content: The carrier blamed bad weather and staffing shortages. It was the second airline this month to face significant disruptions.

title: Why Paid Family Leave’s Demise This Time Could Fuel It Later
content: In failing to secure a benefit with bipartisan appeal, President Biden joins a long line of frustrated politicians. But some Republicans say it could be resurrected on its own.
